instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: My mid 2012 Macbook Pro 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> recently crashed when using a public hotspot. I was poking around the logic board and nicked the soldering for the battery connector with a metallic tool. There is only a faint green led on the power cord when plugged-in. The laptop doesn't power-on either.

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: Dead SMC for a start..... Could be more damage.....

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: Bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4900</CHIP>. 12v went to the 3v data line of the SMC & <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: Don't forget the battery indicator is also on this line and is a suspect. But yeah SMC(<CHIP>U4900</CHIP>) and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> are the first ones to address, start with just <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and see if you get lucky.

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
